item.title: Google introduces AI mode to users in India
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Google introduced its AI mode, a Q&A-style search tool, to users in India today. The company said that this tool is still in the experimental stage and users will need to opt in to it through Search Labs. Once a user has opted in, they can ask queries in English. Google didn’t specify whether it […]

item.title: Court filings reveal OpenAI and io’s early work on an AI device
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: The ChatGPT maker seems to be more than a year out from selling its first hardware device, which may not be an in-ear product whatsoever. Given what the company said in this lawsuit, it appears it is also exploring other form factors.

item.title: Tesla’s robotaxis have already caught the attention of federal safety regulators
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: The U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) contacted Tesla after numerous videos posted online appear to show Tesla robotaxis violating traffic laws in South Austin, where the company is providing rides to invited customers.

item.title: Databricks, Perplexity co-founder pledges $100M on new fund for AI researchers
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Andy Konwinski is pledging $100 million of his own money for a new kind of institute to fund researchers. It's already backed Ion Stoica's new lab.

item.title: Apple’s Liquid Glass interface improves with release of iOS 26 Beta 2
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: These are not likely the final adjustments, given that iOS 26 doesn't launch publicly until the fall. However, they are indications that Apple is actively listening to early user feedback and making tweaks accordingly.

item.title: Canada says telcos were breached in China-linked espionage hacks
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: Salt Typhoon previously hacked phone and telco giants across the United States. The feds say that separate investigations suggest that Salt Typhoon's targeting is "broader than just the telecommunications sector."

item.title: Leak reveals Grok might soon edit your spreadsheets
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Leaked code suggests xAI is developing an advanced file editor for Grok with spreadsheet support, signaling the company’s push to compete with OpenAI, Google, and Microsoft by embedding AI copilots into productivity tools.

item.title: Four months after a $3B valuation, Harvey AI grows to $5B
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The round, which comes just four months after $300 million Series D, was co-led by Kleiner Perkins and Coatue.

item.title: TechCrunch Disrupt 2025: The Builders Stage agenda is now live and taking shape
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Startups don’t build themselves. The Builders Stage at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025, taking place October 27-29 at San Francisco’s Moscone West, is where investors, operators, and founders come to talk tactics.

item.title: Over a million people now have access to the gen-AI powered Alexa+
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Alexa+ is available for free during Early Access and will later be free for Prime customers. Non-Prime users will be able to use the service for $19.99 per month after it publicly launches.

item.title: New York State wants more nuclear power in a big way
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Gov. Kathy Hochul is directing the New York Power Authority, which owns and operates two dozen power plants — mostly dams and gas turbines — to develop the new facility. The plans are still in their infancy: NYPA, a state government entity, has yet to pick a location or a design.

item.title: AllSpice’s platform is the GitHub for electrical engineering teams
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: AllSpice's platform sits between existing workflow software. It allows hardware teams to collaborate on the types of documents they traditionally work in — documents that don't easily translate over Slack and email — like PCB files and electronic CAD files, both of which are used to design circuit boards. AllSpice's platform has landed customers such as Blue Origin and Bose and just raised a $15 million Series A round.

item.title: Senators urge FTC to investigate Spotify’s higher-priced bundled subscription
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Two U.S. senators have requested that the FTC investigate Spotify due to allegations that the company bundled its subscription without user consent, while also undercompensating creators.

item.title: TikTok parent ByteDance is shutting down its short-lived book publisher
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: While authors were drawn to ByteDance's book publisher, 8th Note Press, because it seemed like its affiliation with TikTok could drive sales, the press is now telling writers that it will shut down and give them their publication rights back.

item.title: US insurance giant Aflac says customers’ personal data stolen during cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: Aflac, which provides supplemental insurance to around 50 million individuals whose expenses are not covered by their primary providers, said it was not yet known how many customers are affected by the data breach but that the personal data includes customers' claims, such as Social Security numbers and health information.

item.title: Want to know where VCs are investing next? Be in the room at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Early-stage founders, listen up! You will want a front row seat at the Builders Stage on October 27 at 1:00 p.m. PT. This session at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 brings together Nina Achadjian, partner, Index Ventures; Jerry Chen, general partner, Greylock; and Viviana Faga, general partner, Felicis, all of whom will share their 2026 investment priorities […]

item.title: Japanese shipping firm NYK acquires Kadmos, a salary payment platform for seafarers
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description: NYK approached Kadmos for the acquisition in line with its plan to grow its digital payment business beyond the Philippines. It plans to incorporate the Kadmos platform into MarCoPay, providing payroll solutions to seafaring workers of all nationalities.

item.title: Google adds AI features to Chromebook Plus devices
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Google's adding a slew of AI features to the Chromebook Plus line, including a search and text capture tool, NotebookLM, and a tool for simplifying text.

item.title: SMB-focused Finom closes €115M as European fintech heats up
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Finom's business model centers on providing European SMBs with a financial platform that combines banking, invoicing, and a growing range of features, including AI-enabled accounting. The Amsterdam-based challenger bank for SMBs claims to have doubled its revenue in 2024 and closed a €115 million Series C equity round (around $133 million).

item.title: OpenAI pulls promotional materials around Jony Ive deal due to court order
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: OpenAI appears to have pulled a much-discussed video promoting the friendship between CEO Sam Altman and legendary Apple designer Jony Ive (plus, incidentally, OpenAI’s $6.5 billion deal to acquire Ive and Altman’s device startup io) from its website and YouTube page.
